Text: My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I compose my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
Context: The introduction to the Psalm; the psalmist expresses inspiration to write about a noble theme, possibly reflecting royal wedding festivities or the ideal king.

Text: You are the most handsome of men; grace flows from your lips. Therefore God has blessed you forever.
Context: A poetic praise of the king's royal beauty and eloquence, perhaps symbolic of divine blessing on his reign.

Text: Gird your sword on your side, O mighty one; clothe yourself with splendor and majesty.
Context: A call to the king to arm himself, symbolizing strength and glory, in preparation for a noble task.

Text: In Your majesty, ride forth victoriously for the cause of truth and humility and justice; may Your right hand show Your awesome deeds.
Context: The psalmist urges the king to champion righteousness and justice, implying that the king's endeavors are aligned with divine principles.

Text: Your arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s enemies; nations fall beneath your feet.
Context: Describes the king’s military prowess metaphorically; the arrows may symbolize the king’s ability to subdue his enemies graciously.

Text: Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever, and justice is the scepter of Your kingdom.
Context: Acknowledges the eternal nature of God's rule and the foundational role of justice in His kingdom, could be interpreted prophetically of the Messiah.

Text: You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, Your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy above your peers.
Context: Extols the virtues of the king, highlighting his commitment to righteousness and resulting divine favor.

Text: All your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from palaces adorned with ivory, the music of strings makes you glad.
Context: A vivid portrayal of a regal and joyful setting, the fragrance and music evoking images of wealth and happiness.

Text: Daughters of kings are among your honored women; the queen stands at your right hand, arrayed in Ophir’s gold.
Context: Describes the noble company surrounding the king, signifying honor and prosperity.

Text: Listen, O daughter, consider and incline your ear: Forget your people and your father’s house,
Context: Advises the bride (possibly the queen) to leave her past allegiances for new loyalty to the king, a common practice in royal marriages.

Text: and the king will desire your beauty. Since he is your lord, bow to him.
Context: Encourages the bride to honor the king, assuring her of the king's admiration for her.

Text: The Daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; the wealthiest of people will seek your favor.
Context: Foresees the bride commanding respect and tribute from distant lands and wealthy individuals.

Text: All glorious is the princess within her chamber; her gown is interwoven with gold.
Context: Describes the bride's resplendent appearance with opulence, signifying her royal stature and preparations for the wedding.

Text: In embroidered garments she is led to the king; her virgin companions follow her— those brought to be with her.
Context: A processional image of the bride and her attendants, richly attired, presenting a scene of tradition and ceremony.

Text: Led in with joy and gladness, they enter the palace of the king.
Context: Showcases the celebratory mood and honor as the bride and her party arrive at the king’s residence.

Text: Your sons will take the place of your fathers; you will make them princes throughout the land.
Context: A prophetic blessing for the continuity of the king's legacy, promising enduring influence and rulership.

Text: I will commemorate your name through all generations; therefore, the nations will praise you forever and ever.
Context: A dedication to preserve the king's name eternally, suggesting lasting renown and possibly pointing towards a greater, everlasting king.

Text: Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever, and justice is the scepter of your kingdom. (Note: same as verse 6)
Context: Acknowledges the timeless sovereignty of God's rule, underlining the everlasting reign through the application of justice as its core principle.
